release.action: Changed package to ppwcode structure.
Made java 1.5 compatible, including generics in PersistenBean a.o.
Unit tests for everything.

Removed filter DAO. This experiment was not successful: we did not succeed in making filtering technology independent. And creating our own QL is really a bit too much work. In essence, it is also not necessary: the actual implementation of a filter request should be separated from a filter DAO interface. The latter should just extend Dao: we cannot add anything meaningful on this level for filters.
Removed DAO factories. In practice, they were not used. IoC mechanisms in JSF, Spring, etc., seem to suffice.
Operations now should throw a PersistenceConfigurationError, a PersistenceExternalError or an IllegalPersistenceStateException instead of the older TechnicalException (see the exception vernacular).
Reversed arguments in CrudDao.retrievePersistentBean(Class, _IdType_)
Moved dao implementations package (only Hibernate existed) one level deeper, under the dao package.
Added AbstractDao with 1 property of AbstractHibernateDao.

Methods around AsyncCrudDao do no longer require a nonsense PersistentBean argument. This was intended to be able to throw appropriate PropertyExceptions, that require an origin. In practice, this proved undoable most of the time. Now these methods can throw any more general SemanticException.
SqlExceptionHandlers now throw InternalExceptions.
RamStorage package removed. This was used to do "quick" unit tests. We are grown-ups now, and can do tests in memory with HSQLDB or Derby.

release.description: Hibernate sessions in Hibernate Dao support
release.action: Added support for Hibernate session reference to Hibernate Dao support:
Generalized paging to make Hibernate-independent.
Added a class that does paging retrieve for Hibernate.

JUnit Hibernate tests now do testAllInstances with paging. A protected method that was introduced recently, was changed (this might break compatibility for some classes, but it was rarely used, and the change is easy).

release.description: Correct resetting of id after failed creation.
release.action: Now, HibernateAsyncCrudDao.cancelTransaction correctly resets the id's to null of all created objects (which failed). Previously, we didn't realize that Hibernate already sets the new id during save, and only save during commit, and does not reset the id. Now, on failure, we reset the id of all created objects, also through cascade, to null.
The method isCreated was added to the interface AsyncCrudDao.
Added more information on type invariant failured. Added failedcontidion to debug information
Factored out SQLException handling out of HibernateAsyncCrudDao. Compatible change.

release.description: Fix in create method of AsyncCrudDao
release.action: Removed superfluous session flush.

release.description: Fix in JUnit test helper classes
release.action: Interface of junit.hibernate was missing a method, and had wrong method names. Incompatible for who was using these classes. Luckily, a quick fix.

release.description: PersistentBean is changed into an interface
release.action: PersistentBean is changed into an interface. An abstract subclass AbstractPersistentBean containing a partial implementation of the interface is introduced. The package be.peopleware.persistence_II.junit.hibernate is introduced.
Update of dependencies.
Making dao's Serializable was a mistake. This release fixes that mistake. Don't use I v3.1.0/2.0.
Dao's are now Serializable. This was required, via via, for x:tree2 in JSF. But it actually makes sense in Tomcat, so â€¦

Fixed longstanding toString() issue. toString returned a full description of the bean, effectively (especially during debugging) taking shitloads of time. Now, we just return the standard toString plus the id.
toShortString() and unclosedProperties() methods deprecated
Added methods to produce full String representation of bean, automatically, also for subclasses.
